message: ok, the welcome topics are seriously cool.
As mentioned over in the feedback group I think that _just_ having these "stickied" at the top of the list (as they are, in addition to being the landing page) is the right solution. /rant

Not a fan :( Makes me do extra work to get to the topic list, and for any group not filling in their welcome topic with...whatever's supposed to go in them besides random chat...it looks like an empty group. Hella confusing.

I also think it's a bad idea to make *all* users default to hitting a page which, almost by definition, is intended for users new to the group. Users need to see this page the first time they come to the group, but will be seeing it *every* time. Maketh no sense!
I didn't see that they became the landing page, but o l
@steveivy Sticky topics are totally flippin' rad, yes :)

It's so unintuitive I thought it was a bug not a design decision. Most of my groups go to a blank welcome thread which is utterly pointless and confusing when you could be showing the topic list. On the sticky note, I like the idea of *a* sticky, not multiple - any more than one and you'll end up with the same issue's vBulletin and that lot face (as in, where do the real topics start..)
Someone's even put a follow through link in the Python one: https://convore.com/python/welcome-to-python/
I'm still not convinced it's not a bug :)
@djm I think multiple stickies work fine, provided they are highly visually distinctive.
@bitprophet Yeh, that is key - I still feel there should be a limit. Seeing the same 5+ threads at the top all the time can give off a stagnant feel.
